MOXIFLOXACIN

QUINOLONES

  • Indications and doses
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Cautions
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Local treatment of infections,

To the eye

  • For adults
    Apply 3 times a day continue treatment for 2–3 days after infection improves; review if no improvement within 5 days.
  • For children
    Apply 3 times a day continue treatment for 2–3 days after infection improves; review if no improvement within 5 days.

Sinusitis,

By mouth

  • For adults
    400 mg once daily for 7 days.

Community-acquired pneumonia,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    400 mg once daily for 7–14 days.
  • For adults
    400 mg once daily for 7–14 days, to be given over 60 minutes.

Exacerbations of chronic bronchitis,

By mouth

  • For adults
    400 mg once daily for 5–10 days.

Mild to moderate pelvic inflammatory disease,

By mouth

  • For adults
    400 mg once daily for 14 days.

Complicated skin and soft-tissue infections which have failed to respond to other antibacterials or for patients who cannot be treated with other antibacterials,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    400 mg once daily for 7–21 days.
  • For adults
    400 mg once daily for 7–21 days, to be given over 60 minutes.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

With intravenous use or oral use in adults

Manufacturer advises avoid in severe impairment.

Contra indications

Known side effects

Specific side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: hyperaemia, ocular discomfort, ocular dryness, ocular irritation, ocular pain, taste disturbances, angina in adults, arrhythmias in adults, constipation in adults, flatulence in adults, gastritis in adults, hyperlipidaemia in adults, palpitation in adults, sweating in adults, vasodilatation, angina in adults, arrhythmias in adults, constipation in adults, flatulence in adults, gastritis in adults, hyperlipidaemia in adults, palpitation in adults, sweating in adults, vasodilatation,

uncommon: conjunctival haemorrhage, corneal disorders, corneal erosion, corneal keratitis, corneal staining, eyelid erythema, headache, nasal discomfort, paraesthesia, pharyngolaryngeal pain, visual disturbances, vomiting, dyspnoea in adults, dyspnoea in adults,

rare: abnormal dreams in adults, amnesia in adults, dysphagia in adults, hyperglycaemia in adults, hypertension in adults, hyperuricaemia in adults, incoordination in adults, myopathy in adults, oedema in adults, peripheral neuropathy in adults, stomatitis in adults, syncope in adults, abnormal dreams in adults, amnesia in adults, dysphagia in adults, hyperglycaemia in adults, hypertension in adults, hyperuricaemia in adults, incoordination in adults, myopathy in adults, oedema in adults, peripheral neuropathy in adults, stomatitis in adults, syncope in adults,

veryRare: potentially life-threatening hepatic failure in adults, rhabdomyolysis in adults, potentially life-threatening hepatic failure in adults, rhabdomyolysis in adults,

notKnown: dizziness, dyspnoea, nausea, palpitation, photophobia, pruritus, raised intra-ocular pressure, rash, pain at injection site in adults, phlebitis at injection site in adults,

Advice for patients and carers

Cautions regarding administration

  • When used by eye: not recommended for neonates in neonates

Prepared medicinal forms of MOXIFLOXACIN

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: solution for injection,
Tablet
Solution for infusion
Eye drops
